com.ibm.lpex.alef
Class LpexSourceViewer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.lpex.alef.LpexTextViewer
        |
        +--com.ibm.lpex.alef.LpexSourceViewer
public class LpexSourceViewer
extends LpexTextViewer
implements com.ibm.jface.text.source.ISourceViewer

A line-oriented, LPEX-based partial implementation of com.ibm.jface.text.source.ISourceViewer. One major difference from SourceViewer, this viewer's stream-oriented IDocument is not kept up-to-date with the text changes in the underlying LPEX text widget.

Several SourceViewer classes, methods, and fields are not available in LpexSourceViewer. Most programming of the underlying LPEX widget should be done directly via its LpexView and LpexWindow.

  • public void configure()
    -- refer to this method's documentation.

See Also:
configure(com.ibm.jface.text.source.ISourceViewerConfiguration), LpexTextViewer

Method Detail

createControl

protected void createControl(com.ibm.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
Description copied from class: LpexTextViewer
Hook to actually create the text widget. Here are the steps carried out by this method:
  • a new LpexView is constructed
  • its name parameter is set based on the IFile input element
  • initializeLpexView() is called to set "Open File" preference panel settings and allow the user to set their own parameters for this view
  • initializeWidgetContents() is called to load the file in
  • a new LpexWindow is created and associated with the LpexView
  • listeners are added to the new text widget
  • the updateProfile command is called.
  • the user must add their own LPEX actions and commands by extending updateProfile(), which is called when we are notified of the completion of the updateProfile command.
Overrides:
createControl in class LpexTextViewer
See Also:
LpexTextViewer.createControl(com.ibm.swt.widgets.Composite)

configure

public void configure(com.ibm.jface.text.source.ISourceViewerConfiguration configuration)
Configure the source viewer as described in the configuration.

You should use an ILpexSourceViewerConfiguration to configure an LpexSourceViewer. LpexSourceViewer does not use/implement certain I(Lpex)SourceViewerConfiguration features.

  • configuration.getAutoIndentStrategy()
    -- an LPEX language parser handles its own autoindent strategy
  • configuration.getContentAssist()
    -- using configuration.getLpexContentAssist() instead (defined in ILpexSourceViewerConfiguration)
  • configuration.getDoubleClickStrategy()
    -- LPEX has its own double-click actions. Token/word selection and bracket matching can be customized via new LpexActions.
  • configuration.getTabWidth()
    -- LPEX tab positions for the nextTabStop and prevTabStop actions are configured through the tabs parameter
  • configuration.getUndoManager()
    -- LPEX uses its own built-in undo manager (with unlimited undo/redo capabilitites).
Specified by:
configure in interface com.ibm.jface.text.source.ISourceViewer
Parameters:
configuration - an ILpexSourceViewerConfiguration
See Also:
ILpexSourceViewerConfiguration, ISourceViewer.configure(com.ibm.jface.text.source.ISourceViewerConfiguration), LpexCommonParser

setDocument

public void setDocument(com.ibm.jface.text.IDocument document,
                        com.ibm.jface.text.source.IAnnotationModel annotationModel,
                        int visibleRegionOffset,
                        int visibleRegionLength)
Set the given document as the source viewer's model, and make the specified region visible in the presentation. An approriate TextEvent is issued. The text event does not carry a related document event, though. annotationModel is set as the viewer's annotation model.
Specified by:
setDocument in interface com.ibm.jface.text.source.ISourceViewer
See Also:
ISourceViewer.setDocument(IDocument,IAnnotationModel,int,int)
